intro: Hesperis farsetia, commonly known as the Farsetia honesty, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known garden plants. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Hesperis farsetia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
